result.execSummary:
The defendant Letara T Hawthorne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $30.00 per month commencing 10/3/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 10 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Letara T Hawthorne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Letara T Hawthorne in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $316.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $30.00 per month, commencing 10/3/16, alternate 10 days jail if not paid)    

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Letara T Hawthorne did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 07/08/16.
to appear filed by Attorney Beth Weathers

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Letara T Hawthorne did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers requests an adjournment.  Defendant still needs to sign bond.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Signature bond was not returned, the defendant was released from MHOC.
